@beccanalia at this scale, we must learn ways of getting along that do not require being in front of each other
if we're not getting along, it's not the fault of us being increasingly screen-based, I believe
involves other kinds of sociality, ones that we as a society are not yet so skilled at, but ones that don't inherently deskill face-to-face
@beccanalia not arguing screen-based equivalent; definitely different, in many respects impoverished; but not nevertheless a- or anti-social
@beccanalia Doesn't that demand more not less social skill? Not that people necessarily do, but they can; not inherent to media.
@beccanalia isn't this exchange 'interaction w ppl'? via-screened-people not necessarily less people (tho UX can lessen what gets through)
@beccanalia not sure, I have more faith that sociality is like bike-riding
@beccanalia we are unlearning to face-to-face all on our own - see @SouthwestAir
@beccanalia yes, but wrong to suggest that screens are making us unlearn how to face-to-face (rather than just consuming our time budgets)
